bean.description: This bean provides LDAP facilities to all the other beans. It must implement interface org.esupportail.commons.services.ldap.LdapUserService. This service is used both for searching the attributes of connected users and also for searchin users (get their id from a part of their identity). In the example below, if "smith" is the search string, the search filter will be "cn=*SMITH*", and the corresponding users' ids will be found in attribute uid. This class caches the results of the LDAP requests and supports statistics retrieval.

property.name: i18nService
property.description: The i18nService, used for statistics.

property.name: ldapTemplate
property.description: The LDAP template used to access the LDAP directory.

property.name: dnSubPath
property.description: The DN sub path.

property.name: idAttribute
property.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the unique identifier of users in the LDAP directory (optional, "uid" by default).

property.name: attributesAsString
property.description: The comma-separated list of the LDAP attributes to retrieve.

property.name: searchAttribute
property.description: The LDAP attribute to search for.

property.name: searchDisplayedAttributesAsString
property.description: The comma-separated list of the LDAP attributes to display when searching for users.

property.name: cacheManager
property.description: The cache manager, required.

property.name: cacheName
property.description: The name of the cache, optional.

property.name: testFilter
property.description: The LDAP filter that will be taken into account when using ant target test-ldap.

bean.description: This bean provides LDAP write facilities to all the other beans. It must implement interface org.esupportail.commons.services.ldap.WriteableLdapUserService. This service is used to write in LDAP people branch dn.

property.name: ldapTemplate
property.description: The LDAP template used to access the LDAP directory. May not be set if you want to bind LDAP directory with user account.

property.name: contextSource
property.description: The data source used by the LDAP template. Must be set if ldapTemplate is empty

property.name: dnAuth
property.description: The DN path to use to connect user

property.name: idAuth
property.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the unique identifier of users binding to the LDAP directory

property.name: dnSubPath
property.description: The DN sub path. Used to create or delete entries

property.name: idAttribute
property.description: The LDAP attribute that stores the unique identifier of users in the LDAP directory (optional, "uid" by default).

property.name: attributes
property.description: The LDAP attributes to update.

bean.description: The LDAP template used to acces the LDAP directory. See http://ldaptemplate.sourceforge.net.

property.name: contextSource
property.description: The data source used by the LDAP template.

bean.description: This bean describes the physical acces to the LDAP directory. In the example below, anonymous and unsecured connections will be done to the LDAP directory running on server ldap.esup-portail.org on port 389, using the search base ou=people,dc=esup-portail,dc=edu, with scope "sub". See http://ldaptemplate.sourceforge.net.

property.name: userName
property.description: The dn used to bind to the LDAP directory.

property.name: password
property.description: The password used to bind to the LDAP directory.

property.name: baseEnvironmentProperties
property.description: The environment properties, for instance to set the timeout.
